result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew M Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 
10:10 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  Moves to amend 14CF433 Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01.  Has not filed an amended information.  
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF138 Count 1 - GUILTY
14CF433 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 14CF138 Count 1 and 14CF433 Counts 1 and 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Court orders a PSI. 
Parties to see the Judicial Assistant for a sentencing hearing date. 

BY THECOURT: 
Dismissed and read-in are 14CF269 and 14CF298.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Renc indicates Count 2 of 14CF269 has previously been dismissed. 
Court notes.
Plea hearing on March 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Record Update

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew M. Lehman
Current: 2025 Dixon Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2015)
Prior: 2025 Dixon Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant ANDREW M LEHMAN in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant ANDREW M LEHMAN in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF138, 14CF269, 14CF298, 11CF325, 14CF433

Atty Constable indicates there is confusion re: the offer.  Atty Renc needs to speak with the defendant further, parties do anticipate a plea still.  Asks the Court to hear the SAR in 11CF325 and the initial appearance in 14CF433 at this time. 
Atty Renc concurs.  Asks that the other cases be set for a pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014. 

14CF433 -   
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Attorney Renc waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Preliminary hearing is set for 12/8/14 at 3:00 p.m. 

(14CF138, 14CF269 and 14CF298 are set for a pre-trial conference on 12/8/14 at 9:00 a.m.)

11CF325 - 
Court and both counsel have received the Revocation summary. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court questions jail credit. 
Atty Renc responds.  
Court reviews WCCA for other county case information. 

BY THE COURT: 
11CF325 -
Serve 270 days in jail, concurrent with the Outagamie County sentence he is currently serving. 
174 days credit. 
Unpaid costs are converted to a civil judgment. 

Atty Constable recommends a signature bond in 14CF433 with conditions as stated. 
Atty Renc makes arguments re: the no contact request.  Asks for no abusive contact.
Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on November 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
13CF298 and 14CF269: The no contact is stricken from his bond.  He will be allowed contact while he is in jail.

14CF298: State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Andrew M. Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Andrew M. Lehman in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Renc states the Motion to modify bond to allow contact.
BTC: 13CF298 and 14CF269: The no contact is stricken from his bond.  He will be allowed contact while he is in jail.
Preliminary hearing held on 8/11/14
for Modification of Bond
to Suppress
Arraignment on September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew M. Lehman in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Andrew M. Lehman in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Deputy M. McDonald is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Renc. 
Re-direct exam by Atty Cousins. 

Atty Cousins makes final arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes final arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  
Court makes specific finding for attempted battery to peace officer. 
Bond Continued.  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Atty Renc
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
$2,500 sig bond: No contact with Christina Ross.

Defendant Andrew M. Lehman appeared by video. Prosecuting INtern Krause w/Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC:  $2,500 sig bond: No contact with Christina Ross.
